pros: Salary is always on time and good holiday pay
cons: Not many hours for a part-time position

pros: Immediate team colleagues / some employee benefits
cons: Poor senior leadership as per staff surveys. Unfortunately nothing ever done regarding this and restructures that were to the detriment of the organisation losing key experienced staff and leaving others to try and muddle through under added pressure. Absolutely not working by their company values.

pros: Flexible hours Well staffed most of time
Fair pay, good benegits package, lower level employees great to work with.
cons: Senior Management have head in clouds and Ivory tower syndrome unless you work in main York sites. Unrealistic targets.

pros:
Friendly co-workers, coordinators, management
Plenty of training courses (all paid)
Above min wage
Opportunity to pick up extra shifts
cons:
Unorganised due to stress of pandemic
Often understaffed sometimes quite severely

pros: Fantastic people who all want to do their utmost to help and support existing and potential tenants with their needs
cons: The level of disorganisation and lack of communication is atrocious. IT systems are not fit for purpose, despite being encouraged to suggest new ideas and move the business forward anything suggested falls on deaf ears and there seems to be no accountability for those managing staff. Despite annual reviews (PDR) there is no financial rewards to 'exceed expectations' and very little opportunity to progress in the organisation. JRHT is genuinely stuck in a rime warp!

pros:
I’m in my first year with JRF and am  really enjoying it. It’s been the best start to a job I’ve had.

I feel I’ve been brought in for what I can offer and am given room to shape my role, I don’t have to fit into a box they’d created for me. 

My team and manager are super supportive and welcoming to all sorts of new ideas. 

I’m a big fan of the new ways of working and move to matrix working, it’s not all going to smooth going, but we’re moving in the right direction.
cons: The salaries are not as high as private sector but you get to home knowing you’re helping to solve poverty.

review_title: IT Department is a total shambles!
job_title: Service Desk Analyst Trainee in York, England
pros: Not many, besides the fact they were keen to hire me and get me started quickly (only then to be disappointed and messed about!)
cons: The management in IT is a shambles and is the same in all other departments too, nobody knows what is happening or who manages what, it's a total mess, chaotic, disjointed. Management is also full of ego, they are not confidence inspiring at all, they like to keep you below them and not equal.

pros:
Always being approachable and flexible to employees ensure employees welfare.
Offering excellent salaries
providing excellent training and encouraging workers to come to them should there be a work related course that they would like to undertake that is not offered at JRF
cons: I can honestly say from my experience of working for JRF that I did not find any serious cons of working for them throughout.

pros: Look after their staff, good range of staff benefits. Flexible working where possible.
cons: Repeated internal reorganisations and departmental changes have left some staff feeling disgruntled but most change has been handled with care.

pros: Goal of the organisation and ethos, training opportunities if you work in the right department
cons: Sometimes seems a bit organised. While some people work by the ethos and values, sometimes i feel like others do not follow the values and ethos
